Package edu.aau.g404.protocol.https

package edu.aau.g404.protocol.https
Provides classes for handling HTTPS request in the IoT system.

This package contains classes that implement various types of HTTPS requests, such as GET, POST, PUT and DELETE. These classes are used for interacting with smart devices and APIs that support secure communication over HTTPS.

Additionally, the SSLHelper class is provided to disable SSL verification, which can be useful during development and testing.

  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    edu.aau.g404.protocol
    Provides classes for various communication protocols used for communication with IoT systems.
    edu.aau.g404.protocol.udp
    Provides classes for handling UDP requests in the IoT system.
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    HttpsGetRequest<T extends SmartDevice>
    HttpsGetRequest class handles HTTP GET requests and deserializes the JSON resposne into a list of SmartDevice objects.
    HttpsPostRequest<T extends SmartDevice>
    HttpsPostRequest class handles HTTP POST requests.
    HttpsPutRequest<T extends SmartDevice>
    HttpsPutRequest class handles HTTP PUT requests and sends an updated SmartDevice object to the endpoint.
    HttpsRequest
    Abstract class HttpsRequest represents a base class for HTTPS requests.
    SSLHelper
    SSLHelper class is a utility class that disables SSL certificate verification for the application.
